column4: im trying to replace my xorg.conf file, but it wont let me paste the new file or rename the old one?
are you doing it as sudo?
sudo cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /to where you want it copied
im trying to replace the current xorg.conf file, which needs to be in /etc/x11/ ? as far as i understood atleast..
cannot create regular file, no such file or directory...who new that copying a file could be this painful :)
a question is if it is not there why do you need it, but anyway....
i need to change it to get my resolution fixed
says the file isnt there or the directory, but i can see it in the file browser
do a ls -l , is it shown?
where do you want me to put the ls-l in ? when i did it in the terminal it came up as command not found
doh... when i tried to do the cp command i typed the x11 with a lowercase.. think its all good now :P thanks
